hero.title: I am Palmira Solochi!
hero.text: From law to QA (Selenium, BDD) and programming (COBOL, Java). A story of career change, faith and determination that shows it is never too late to start again.

quotes: If it is done with attention, it is not by accident.
I work with focus, clarity and the same energy.

article.title: My story
paragraphs: I am Palmira Solochi, a woman driven by faith in God, determination and a constant desire to grow.
I believe true success is born when we bring together technical competence, analytical rigor and human values.

After solid experience in law and executive secretarial work, I decided to change careers into technology, combining my ability for rigorous analysis, clear communication and a strong focus on quality.
I completed training in Quality Assurance (QA) with experience in manual and automated testing (Selenium, Cypress, Cucumber, BDD).
I am currently attending a technical programming course, deepening my knowledge of COBOL, mainframe, Java and security.
The path has not always been easy. I am a mother of three children and, even in the most challenging moments, I never gave up.

While working as an Uber driver, often between ten and fifteen hours a day, I stayed committed to my studies and to my faith. My belief in God has been and continues to be the fuel that pushes me forward with courage and purpose.

Today I see technology as a place where I can unite logic with empathy, technical discipline with human sensitivity. I believe technology is also a place for strong and persistent women, full of courage and faith, able to change the world around them.
“With faith in God and courage in her heart, a woman can turn any pain into a new beginning.”
• It is never too late to start again.
• Do not let fear or the opinion of others stop you from being who you are.
• With grit, faith in God and determination, what seems impossible can turn into achievement.
